documents.title: hospital merger plans : no switch in services
text: concerns over hospital services being moved to different locations were raised during a meeting in peterborough to discuss a proposed merger between two nhs trusts .
last week it was reported £ 9m could be saved if peterborough and stamford hospitals nhs trust joined with hinchingbrooke hospital .
but the proposals have faced much criticism , with more than 400 people marching against the merger back in april .
the board of directors at peterborough city hospital ( who today backed the full business case , said there were no plans to change the sites of services .

text: a board meeting at peterborough and stamford hospitals nhs trust discussing a proposed merger with hinchingbrooke hospital has heard it would lead to some job losses .

documents.title: congestion plans to include enhanced cycling infrastructure
text: perhaps not surprisingly in a city famous for its bikes , the measures being proposed to tackle congestion in cambridge include enhancing the cycling infrastructure .
the greater cambridge city deal says it wants a comprehensive city and south cambridgeshire cycle network , linked to towns and villages .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: companies could be charged for parking spaces to tackle cambridge congestion
text: one of the main points that sprung out from the announcement to tackle cambridge 's congestion was the proposed introduction of a `` workplace parking levy '' .
it 's based on a scheme in nottingham and would see employers with lots of parking space for employees charged an annual fee for each commuter parking space they have .

according to officers for the greater cambridge city deal , all funds raised would be used to encourage people to switch to other modes of transport , as well as create an `` important new funding stream to invest in better local transport to ease commuter trips '' .
they say the annual charge per parking space in nottingham is £ 375 ( equivalent to £ 1.50 per working day ) .
if this figure was applied to cambridge , it could raise revenue in the order of £ 7m to £ 11m per annum .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'workplace levy ' instead of congestion charge to tackle cambridge traffic
text: officers reporting to the greater cambridge city deal have ruled out a congestion charge in favour of proposing other measures to try and tackle transport issues in the city .
they suggest improving public transport and introducing a `` workplace parking levy '' and new on-street parking controls .
the greater cambridge city deal is a body given powers and funding from central government to make improvements to `` secure future economic growth and quality of life '' in the city .
it is a partnership between various councils , enterprise partnerships and the university of cambridge .

documents.title: cambridge trying not to house syrian refugees in council houses
text: lewis herbert , the labour leader of cambridge city council , has just been talking on bbc radio cambridgeshire about its efforts to help resettle syrian refugees .
the city has committed to taking 50 refugees and some families arrived in the city before christmas .
he said there had been `` a lot of offers '' from people in the city to help refugees : `` our aim this year is that almost everything we do will use other housing , not council houses . ''
`` of course we have people who need housing , and i 'm thinking of them , '' he added .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: closing crossings will help improve rail services , says network rail
text: network rail says plans to close 33 level crossings in the county will `` help improve reliability and enable separate , potential future developments for faster and more frequent services '' .
it has identified about 130 crossings it believes could be closed or modified across the region .
people are being invited to three consultation events in march , ely and cambridge to see network rail 's plans .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: plans to close level crossings in cambridgeshire unveiled by network rail
text: network rail has released proposals to close or change the use of 33 level crossings across cambridgeshire .
none of the crossings in this proposal are on public a or b roads .

richard schofield , network rail 's route managing director for anglia , said : `` our plans to close level crossings propose small changes to how people cross the railway , but the closures will help us reduce the risks that level crossings pose , improve safety and reliability of the railway for the future . ''
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough 's 'long and proud history ' of helping refugees
text: `` this city has a long and proud history ​of welcoming those that need our help , '' said john holdich , leader of peterborough city council , after the announcement 100 syrians will be resettled in the city .
the council says five families will resettle in the city every year for the next five years , and families will ty be two adults and two children .

`` the government has confirmed we will receive appropriate levels of funding for these families and over the next few months we will be making appropriate arrangements to prepare for their arrival , '' said mr holdich .
